title: I have seen DJ Sona two maybe three times
body:
Why so rare? Yes skin is EXPENSIVE but Udyr was freaking everywhere every other game when SGU was released. Now with Sona I have only had DJ once on my team AND SHE WAS AFK so no sick tunes for me or the team.

The skin looks nice, what has been the general impression for those who have seen it more regularly?

replies.body: I have sona and enjoy using her, but I feel you are more reliant on having a good adc than say morgana or janna.

I own the skin, but overall I think I will stick to arcade Sona. I am sick of my teammates ordering me to change the song I am playing and getting really pissed at me if I don't. 

The accompanying music is for all forms are pretty cool (everyone has their favourite, I like ethereal). The way the abilities and their auras change is also super cool, and can really put enemies off if they aren't expecting a change. I have also found it a little bit harder to keep track of her passive (when enemies play her), but maybe that is just me being blinded and confused with all the fancy particle effects XD

As to the reason why she died off so easily: I have seen so many people pick up Sona, and try to play her full ap and fail spectacularly, leaving her and their expensive skin alone. She is also super squishy and a surprising amount of people can't handle that.

People just don't know how to drop the bass...

Every DJ sona I've seen so far build a spellthiefs and then just rushes lich bane which to be honest is just plain silly. Ever since her ratio nerfs on her q (which contrary to many people I believe were required as her early game damage was absurd)  Building Sona AP doesn't really give that many benefits as building support and mana regen items. Secondly a lot of people think Sona is a %%%% champ because Riot slightly nerfed her, In reality Sona is still great and provides a lot of early game poke and late game utility.  The last thing about Sona is that like many supports she isn't really a bigplay champ. She's squishy has no gapcloser and most of her utility comes from passive auras and tagging the correct enemy with the correct powerchord. For people who are use to playing champs such as Zed and Irelia playing a champ with no escape like Sona is a foreign concept to them. They often go really balllsy in lane thinking they can get kills and carry their adc and end up just dying.

Also something I need to get off my back that has been pissing my off for ages is everyone who complains that Sona is %%%% because of her ratio nerfs. I believe that Sona was actually the most OP support in the game prior to these nerfs as she had some of the highest level 1 burst and poke damage in the game well still providing great utility. If memory serves me right prior nerf Sona's winrate was something like 56%. now its about 52%. She also has the benefit of being easy to play **as long as you play her like a proper support** and has an ult that can decide a team-fight in an instant.  If you've got a friend that plays ADC ask them to play Ashe and duo with them as Sona. The result can be spectacular.
Because Riot gutted Sona with their %%%%ty half-assed reworked and now she's not viable unless it's aram.

People realized Sona sucks and have stopped using her, on some real %%%% what the hell did people think was gonna happen? Giving a %%%% champion an ultimate skin is not going to make people play the champion, it might for a couple weeks but then it will stop, difference between SGU and DJ Sona is that Udyr isn't a %%%% champion.
